abstract: Google, whose Google News is among the largest news aggregators, is asking the people or companies mentioned in news articles to comment on those reports.
snippet: Google, whose Google News is among the largest news aggregators, is asking the people or companies mentioned in news articles to comment on those reports.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 12  The Internet offers immediate access to articles about every breaking news event anywhere in the world. But no one in the media business has quite figured out how to exploit that revolutionary fact.

headline.main: Names in the News Get a Way to Respond
headline.print_headline: Names in the News Get a Way to Respond

abstract: EMC‘s VMware software business plans to raise as much as $1.1 billion Monday in what may be the largest technology offering since Google in 2004, a signal that demand remains robust for computer-related companies.
lead_paragraph: EMC‘s VMware software business plans to raise as much as $1.1 billion Monday in what may be the largest technology offering since Google in 2004, a signal that demand remains robust for computer-related companies.

headline.main: All Hyped Up, VMWare Preps for I.P.O.

abstract: Yahoo’s quarterly filing shows extent of shareholder discontent with board: More than one-third of all shares voted against the reelection of the three directors on its compensation committee.
snippet: Yahoo’s quarterly filing shows extent of shareholder discontent with board: More than one-third of all shares voted against the reelection of the three directors on its compensation committee.
lead_paragraph: The recent history of Yahoo’s troubles is well-known: the company lost the search race to Google; it missed out on key trends — social networking, for instance — and potential acquisitions — Facebook, most notably; its performance disappointed; some shareholders grew restless and focused their anger on a board that gave former CEO Terry Semel one of the richest pay packages in Corporate America.
